title: NY magazine - condensed gothic
content:
Can anyone identify this great condensed gothic found in this week's New York magazine?

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20121028120713im_/http:/typophile.com/files/show&talk_5627.gif)

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [show&talk.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20121028120713/http:/typophile.com/files/show&talk.jpg) | 7.34 KB |
author: skyfein

comments.content:
That has to be it, Lex. Knockout #46 Flyweight looks like a ringer.

And yet... the "S" in the New York type sample curves in at the ends, which Knockout Flyweight doesn't appear to do. (Hard to tell because of the interface on Knockout's type preview page.)

Every time I visit this board, I am blown away, and this time is no exception!

There is also Jim Parkinson's [ITC Roswell](http://web.archive.org/web/20121028120713/http:/www.fontshop.com/index.cfm?fuseaction=verity.search&startrow=1&records=20&currpage=1&totalrecords=4&searchby=&searchID=&searchletter=&searchstr=roswell&font_categories_checkbox=font_name_search&fontRendererText=SHOW+%26+TALK) in this vein.

Parkinson's Balboa also came to mind.

- Lex
